page.title: 01General Description
page.content: The Nether Stowey area is one of outstanding natural beauty. Part of it is the eastern slopes of the Quantock Hills, descending into the lower grazing and farming areas. To the east, is the village of Nether Stowey, situated at the foot of the Castle Mount and adjacent to the main A39 Bridgwater to Minehead road. Included in this area is the smaller village of Over Stowey with its own church, and passed by the road to Taunton. On the other side of the A39 towards the coast we find Dodington, a cluster of homes within a farming community, but once an active copper mining centre in the 18th century.
